titleStmt.title: George E. Roe et al. to Unknown
CWG9403

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
To his Excellency
The Governor of the Commonwealth of Ky

Whereas at the last term of the Greenup Circuit. Joseph Brown was fine the Sum of twenty five Dollars. for a breach of the publick peace. John Brown Lewis Brown and Hose Howe were fine in the Sum of ten Dollars apeice for alike offense. all the above persons are very poor and in humble circumstances and were from the testimony provoked. to commit the offense for which they were tried & fine. We the undersigned citizens of Greenup County and their neighbors would respectfully petition your Excellency -- to remit said fine all except cost &c

Geo E Roe county Atty
James Bryan
J. Luparing
William Corum Clerk.
John Holland
Allen Mays Jailer
B F Pratt
Jacob Rake
J. S. Hurd
C, W, Van Bibber
